curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Bulk Waste includes items such as furniture, appliances, and other large household materials.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Heavy trash should be placed at the curb between 6:00 p.m. the Friday before and 7:00 a.m. on the scheduled collection day. Place items so they are accessible to the collection vehicle. Do not stack under wires, signs, or mailboxes, or on top of water/gas meters, hydrants, or other utilities. Do not place items in the street, on the sidewalk, or in a way that blocks traffic.
curbside_rules.size_limits: No more than 8 cubic yards (about the size of a minivan) of heavy trash may be set out. Up to 4 cubic yards of building material (excluding shingles, brick, plaster, or concrete) may be collected if generated by the resident. Residents may place up to 4 tires at the curb for collection during Bulk Waste months.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Appliances containing refrigerant must have a certified technician’s tag showing the refrigerant has been removed. Contractor-generated material (tree removal, construction, roofing, remodeling, etc.) will not be collected. Contractors are responsible for removing their debris. If authorized and unauthorized items are mixed, the entire pile may be refused. Collection services are not available to multi-residential structures with more than eight units. Service is limited to occupied residential units and vacant residential lots where the waste is generated from maintenance of the property.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Residents may place Tree Waste and Bulk Waste together for curbside collection once a month.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Houston averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.
